buldingInd.description: When true, the information is a building name.

purge.description: Date an item will be purged from a database (e.g., from a live database to an archive).

Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier.   This could be GUID a UUID or any other string that an organization that distinctly identifies the specific object.

Ideally, for the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

implementers: Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

Surname.description: Family name, last name. \nNote: Simple form of person name should be used for the full name.\nMay also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.

Family name, last name. \nNote: Simple form of person name should be used for the full name.\nMay also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.

type.description: Type of name of the individual, such as former, nickname, alternate or alias name. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Name Type (NAM).

language.description: The language the name is represented in, e.g. an Eastern name versus a Western name.

defaultInd.description: If true, this is the default or primary name within a collection of names.

type.description: Type of name of the individual, such as former, nickname, alternate or alias name. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Name Type (NAM).

language.description: The language the name is represented in, e.g. an Eastern name versus a Western name.

defaultInd.description: If true, this is the default or primary name within a collection of names.

Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

StateProv.description: The standard code or abbreviation for the state, province, or region.

id.description: Used elsewhere in the message to reference a specific telephone number (including faxes).

defaultInd.description: When true, indicates a default value should be used.

Text.description: Provides text and indicates whether it is formatted or not.

language.description: The language in which the text is provided.

textFormat.description: Indicates the format of text used in the description e.g. unformatted  or html.

number.description: The sequence number for the paragraph.
The sequence number for the paragraph.
The sequence number for the paragraph.

TimeSpan.description: Specifies the arrival date and departure date which covers the whole Reservation.

URL.description: Web site address, in IETF specified format.

defaultInd.description: Indicates whether or not this is the default URL.

language.description: The language in which the text is provided.

textFormat.description: Indicates the format of text used in the description e.g. unformatted  or html.

Code.description: Any code used to specify an item, for example, type of traveler, service code, room amenity, etc.  May be used to reference the OpenTravel RMA Codelist.

PayloadStdAttributes.description: The standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OpenTravel messages.

timeStamp.description: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ with time values using the 24 hour clock:\n20 November 2003, 1:59:38 pm UTC becomes 2003-11-20T13:59:38Z

target.description: Test or Production target system indicator.

version.description: The OpenTravel message version indicated by a decimal value.

transactionIdentifier.description: Unique identifier to relate all messages within a transaction (e.g. this would be sent in all request and response messages that are part of an on-going transaction).

sequenceNmbr.description: Implementer: Message resynchronization typically is required if a system has been off-line and needs to retrieve messages that were missed.

transactionStatusCode.description: This indicates where this message falls within a sequence of messages.

retransmissionIndicatorInd.description: Implementer: It is recommended that this attribute is used (i.e., set to TRUE) only when a message is retransmitted.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

Geolocation.description: TODO-(use enums and other for lat,long??  Format for the lat and long, is there a XML format)Used to specify the geographic coordinates of a location.

altitudeUnitOfMeasure_Enum.description: Provides the unit of measure for the altitude (e.g., feet, meters, miles, kilometers). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Unit of Measure Code (UOM).

mapURL.description: The URL of a map image.

formatURL.description: The URL to the format for the latitude and longitude for this location.

primaryInd.description: Indicates whether the enumerated booking channel is the primary means of connectivity used by the source.

Street.description: May contain the street number when the Street number element is missing.

City.description: City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address).

Remark.description: A remark associated with this address.

examples.value: This address should be used for all official correspondences.

validInd.description: If true, this is a valid and complete mailing address that has been verified through an address verification service or previously mailed materials have not been returned.

IndexPointCode_Enum.description: Indicates the type of location being referenced (e.g., Airport, Hotel).

validInd.description: If true, this is a valid email address that has been system verified via a successful email transmission.

defaultInd.description: If true, this identifies this is the default email address.

lastUpdated.description: The date and time when the collection of multimedia information was last updated.

objID.description: A unique identifier within this document for this object.

VideoCategoryRef.description: Refers to the obj ID on an object defined elsewhere in the current document.

language.description: The language associated with the caption for the category.

removalInd.description: If true, this item is obsolete and should be removed from the receiving system.

language.description: The language in which the content is provided.

implementers: Example value: ca1 = The Empire State Building at sunset.
Example value: tns = The Empire State Building at sunset.

examples.value: The Empire State Building at sunset.

MultimediaDetails.description: Warning:  To be redesigned in the next release. The title of the multimedia object.

applicableStart.description: Start month and day or date for which the multimedia content is relevent (e.g. the start of a season or the start of an event). When a year is not used (i.e. only the month and day) it signifies a recurring event.

applicableEnd.description: End month and day or date for which the multimedia content is relevent (e.g. the end of a season or the start of an event). When a year is not used (i.e. only the month and day) it signifies a recurring event.

objID.description: A unique identifier within this document for this object.

VideoRef.description: Refers to the obj ID on an object defined elsewhere in the current document.

width.description: The width of the video item (unit specified by unit of measure).

height.description: The height of the video item (unit specified by unit of measure).

bitRate.description: The bit rate of the video item.

length.description: The length of the video item (unit specified by unit of measure).

version.description: The version of the video item.

fileSize.description: The size of the multimedia file in bytes.

URL.description: URL of the multimedia item for a specific format.

Rating.description: The actual award or rating received by the facility.

provider.description: The name of the award or ratings provider.

ProcessingInfo.description: Transaction processing directives, including display currency overrides. If no display currency information is provided, the display and pricing currency will default to the value in POS\/Source\/@ISOCurrency.

implementers: (Developer Notes) An agreement should be in place with your trading partners that specifies what information is summary versus detail.

positiveInteger.description: The maximum quantity of search results in the response.

summaryResultsInd.description: If true, summary information is requested in the search results.

RateRange.description: A range of monetary values within which the cost of the available products are requested.

rateTimeUnit.description: Used to specify the period of time to which the rates apply.

unitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure for the radius value.

LocationCode.description: Location code is city, stateProvence, or country code

objID.description: A unique identifier within this document for this object.

ImageRef.description: Refers to the obj ID on an object defined elsewhere in the current document.

version.description: The version of the video item.

URL.description: URL of the multimedia item for a specific format.

originalIndicatorInd.description: When true, the image is the original file and format. When false, the image is not the original file and format.

direction.description: Defines the cardinal direction (e.g., north, south, southwest).

distance.description: Defines the distance between two points.

unitOfMeasureCode.description: The unit of measure in a code format. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Unit of Measure Code (UOM).

indexPointCode.description: This is the object referred to by the relative position (e.g. cross street, airport). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Index Point Code (IPC).

toFrom.description: Used to indicate whether the context is to a facility or from a facility.

positionAccuracy.description: Indicates the accuracy of the property's geo-coding, since the property's longitude and latitude may not always be exact. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Position Accuracy Code (PAC).

nearestInd.description: The indicator for whether this location is nearest.

primaryInd.description: Indicates whether the reference point is considered the main reference point for the specific type of IndexPointCode (e.g., in Dallas, where IndexPointCode=airport Dallas\/Fort Worth airport would be the primary airport even if another airport such as Love Field is closer).

approximateDistanceInd.description: When true, the distance information is approximate.

distance.description: Defines the distance between two points.

unitOfMeasureCode.description: The unit of measure in a code format. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Unit of Measure Code (UOM).

indexPointCode.description: This is the object referred to by the relative position (e.g. cross street, airport). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Index Point Code (IPC).

nearestInd.description: The indicator for whether this location is nearest.

primaryInd.description: Indicates whether the reference point is considered the main reference point for the specific type of IndexPointCode (e.g., in Dallas, where IndexPointCode=airport Dallas\/Fort Worth airport would be the primary airport even if another airport such as Love Field is closer).

approximateDistanceInd.description: When true, the distance information is approximate.

objID.description: A unique identifier within this document for this object.

TransportationRef.description: Refers to the obj ID on an object defined elsewhere in the current document.

typicalTravelTime.description: The normal (average) travel time required to get to or from the location, measured in minutes.

Description.description: Descriptive text that describes the transportation.

includedInd.description: When true there is no additional charge for transportation.

removalInd.description: If true, this item is obsolete and should be removed from the receiving system.

subSectionNumber.description: This attribute may be used when there is a need to number all of the sub-sections of information that is to be presented.

includedInd.description: If TRUE, this is included with the purchase.

orderableInd.description: If TRUE, this ancillary may be ordered.

Dimensions.description: Defines the dimensions of an object.

width.description: The width of the image item (unit specified by unit of measure).

height.description: The height of the image item (unit specified by unit of measure).

size.description: The size of the multimedia file in bytes.

objID.description: A unique identifier within this document for this object.

lastUpdated.description: The date and time when the multimedia information was last updated.

version.description: The version of the content, typically in the form of \"1\" or \"2.3.\"

language.description: The language associated with the caption for the category.
